sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The arccos function is used to find the arc cosine of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, arccos (0.5) is p / 3.
sections.text_content: The arccos function is used to find the arc cosine of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, arccos (0.5) is p / 3.
sections.mdown_content: The **arccos** function is used to find the arc cosine of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, **arccos** (0.5) is p / 3.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : -4 .. 4
            const arg := i / 4
            put "Arc cosine of ", arg, " is ",
                arccos (arg), " radians"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the arccosine of -1 through 1 in radians.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the arccosine of -1 through 1 in radians.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the arccosine of -1 through 1 in radians.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the arcsin and arctan functions for calculating arcsine and arctangent.

the arccosd function which finds the arc cosine of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the arcsin and arctan functions for calculating arcsine and arctangent.
the arccosd function which finds the arc cosine of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[arcsin.html](arcsin)** and **[arctan.html](arctan)** functions for calculating arcsine and arctangent.
the **[arccosd.html](arccosd)** function which finds the arc cosine of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
